message: @leah That would be awesome.
@oskarkrawczyk sure. I'll add it asap.

I was super-excited to get a Cappuccino p-o-s app up and running just to find out there's not JSONP available, which is a bit of a pain, since I really don't want to overcomplicate things with a proxy JSON->JSONP. Any plans of adding a wrapper callback for the current API?
Test case: http://jsfiddle.net/m6XMV/
You're the boss! Works like a charm http://jsfiddle.net/LRvPh/

Ok, it kind of works, but only if the provided callback key doesn't have any special chars. Say I'd want to use a framework (in my case MooTools). What it does is automagically provide a callback key, which looks like this: Request.JSONP.request_map.request_0
@oskarkrawczyk no problem. Thanks for helping debug!
@oskarkrawczyk okay done
try it out and let me know what you think
Testing ...
So the URL would be: https://convore.com/api/account/verify.json?callback=Request.JSONP.request_map.request_0
Unfortunately convore fails to create a function wrapper if a dot is present in a string
Flickr, Twitter, etc, they all accept the "." char
@oskarkrawczyk okay, good to know
I'll set it up to allow the "."
okay done :D
Let the fun commence! :-) Thanks @leah
Just noticed that the `callback` param doesn't work on live.json. It just returns a non-wrapped JSON: `{"messages": []}`. Test case:  http://jsfiddle.net/oskar/zk8kC/
Thanks
@oskarkrawczyk okay, I'll try to get to that soon
@oskarkrawczyk okay, jsonp should now work with live.json. sorry for the delay!
